---
title: "Add a MediaList"
description: How to add a list of media items to your LightNet page. 
---

import { Aside } from "@astrojs/starlight/components"

LightNet provides a `MediaList` component that displays a list of media items.
This component is meant to be used inside a `Section` with maximum width set to `narrow`. 
Prefer the [MediaGallerySection](/build/pages/media-gallery-section) on the homepage.

Here is an example on how to use the `MediaList` component:

```astro
---
import { Page, MediaList, Section } from "lightnet/components"
import { getMediaItems } from "lightnet/content"

const someEnglishBooks = await getMediaItems({
  where: { type: "book", language: "en" },
  orderBy: "dateCreated",
  limit: 10
})

const { t } = Astro.locals.i18n
---

<Page>
    <Section title={t("x.english-books.title")} maxWidth="narrow" >
        <MediaList items={someEnglishBooks} />
    </Section>
</Page>
```

Inside the frontmatter the `someEnglishBooks` variable is prepared using LightNet's [getMediaItems function](/build/pages/query-media-items). 
The items are displayed in a vertical list.

## Reference

The `MediaList` component has the following properties:

### `items`

type: `MediaItem[]` \
example: `const books = await getMediaItems({/*...*/})` \
required: `true`

The array of media items to display.
